snippet: The United States added 227,000 jobs in February, the third straight month of gains over 200,000, while the unemployment rate stayed at 8.3 percent, the Labor Department reported.
abstract: “Labor Department reports that the US economy added 227,000 jobs in February;” unemployment rate holds steady at 8.3 percent, a reflection of the nearly half a million people who joined or are resuming the search for work; three consecutive months of solid employment growth is likely to boost Pres Obama’s prospects for re-election, as he makes the case that his economic policies are working.

byline.contributor: Robbie Brown and Jackie Calmes contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The United States added 227,000 jobs in February, the third straight month of gains over 200,000, while the unemployment rate stayed at 8.3 percent, the Labor Department reported.

headline.seo: February Jobs Report Has Gain of 227,000; Jobless Rate at 8.3%
headline.main: U.S. Extends Its Run of Strong Job Growth Another Month
headline.print_headline: Economy Shows Solid Job Gains For a 3rd Month
